org.knime.core.node.workflow

Class BatchExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.node.workflow.BatchExecutor

  • public class BatchExecutor
extends Object
    Simple utility class that takes a workflow, either in a directory or zipped into a single file, executes it and saves the results in the end. If the input was a ZIP file the workflow is zipped back into a file.
    Author:
    Thorsten Meinl, University of Konstanz

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BatchExecutor.BatchException
      Exception that can be thrown by subclasses in executeWorkflow(WorkflowManager, WorkflowConfiguration).
      static class  BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException
      Exception for illegal or broken options.
      protected static class  BatchExecutor.WorkflowConfiguration

      • BatchExecutor

        public BatchExecutor(String[] args)
              throws IOException,
                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException,
                     BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException,
                     BatchExecutor.BatchException
        Creates a new batch executor.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException - if the preference cannot be read from the specified file
        BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException - if a setting is missing or invalid
        BatchExecutor.BatchException - may be thrown by subclass implementations; the real exception is available via the cause of the batch exception
        Since:
        2.7

    • Method Detail

      • processArguments

        protected void processArguments(String[] args)
                         throws IOException,
                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException,
                                BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException,
                                BatchExecutor.BatchException
        This method is called by the constructor in order to process the command line arguments. The default implementation reads the configuration for a single workflow from the arguments using parseConfigFromArguments(String[]). Subclasses may override this method to do their own processing. Keep in mind that this method is called from the constructor i.e. instance fields of subclasses are not initialized yet!
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException - if the preference cannot be read from the specified file
        BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException - if an option is invalid or missing
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        BatchExecutor.BatchException - may be thrown by subclass implementations; the real exception is available via the cause of the batch exception
        Since:
        2.7

      • parseConfigFromArguments

        protected BatchExecutor.WorkflowConfiguration parseConfigFromArguments(String[] args)
                                                                throws org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException,
                                                                       FileNotFoundException,
                                                                       BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException
        Reads a workflow configuration from command line arguments.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments, see usage()
        Returns:
        a new workflow configuration
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException - if the preference cannot be read from the specified file
        BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException - if an option is invalid or missing
        FileNotFoundException - if the specified preferences file was not found
        Since:
        2.7

      • handleCommandlineArgument

        protected void handleCommandlineArgument(String[] parts,
                                         String s,
                                         BatchExecutor.WorkflowConfiguration config)
                                  throws FileNotFoundException,
                                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException,
                                         BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException
        Handles a single command line argument (pair).
        Parameters:
        parts - a one or two-element array of the command line arguments. The first part is the argument name, the second the optional value
        s - the complete (un-split) argument
        config - the current workflow configuration into which the processed argument must be filled in
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException - if the preference cannot be read from the specified file
        BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException - if an option is invalid or missing
        FileNotFoundException - if the specified preferences file was not found
        Since:
        2.7

        protected void usage()
        Since:
        2.7

        public static String getOptionsString()
        Returns:

        public static String getPropertiesString()

      • mainRun

        public static int mainRun(String... args)
        Parses the command line and starts up KNIME. It returns whether execution was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments, see output of usage()
        Returns:
        an exit code, one of EXIT_SUCCESS, EXIT_WARN, EXIT_ERR_PRESTART, EXIT_ERR_LOAD, or EXIT_ERR_EXECUTION

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
        Main method.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line parameters, see usage()
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • loadWorkflow

        protected WorkflowManager loadWorkflow(BatchExecutor.WorkflowConfiguration config)
                                throws IOException,
                                       InvalidSettingsException,
                                       CanceledExecutionException,
                                       UnsupportedWorkflowVersionException,
                                       LockFailedException,
                                       BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException
        Loads a single workflow.
        Parameters:
        config - the workflow configuration
        Returns:
        the workflow manager representing the loaded workflow
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while loading the workflow
        InvalidSettingsException - if some node or workflow settings are invalid
        CanceledExecutionException - if loading the workflow is canceled by the user (should not happen in batch mode)
        UnsupportedWorkflowVersionException - if the workflow version is not supported
        LockFailedException - if the workflow cannot be locked
        BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException - if a node option is invalid
        Since:
        2.7

      • executeWorkflow

        protected boolean executeWorkflow(WorkflowManager wfm,
                                  BatchExecutor.WorkflowConfiguration config)
                           throws CanceledExecutionException,
                                  BatchExecutor.BatchException
        Executes a workflow.
        Parameters:
        wfm - the workflow manager
        config - the corresponding workflow configuration
        Returns:
        true if the workflow executed successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        CanceledExecutionException - if execution has been canceled by the user
        BatchExecutor.BatchException - may be thrown by subclass implementations; the real exception is available via the cause of the batch exception
        Since:
        2.7

      • saveWorkflow

        protected void saveWorkflow(WorkflowManager wfm,
                            BatchExecutor.WorkflowConfiguration config)
                     throws IOException,
                            CanceledExecutionException,
                            LockFailedException
        Saves the workflow after execution.
        Parameters:
        wfm - the workflow manager
        config - the corresponding workflow configuration
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while saving th workflow
        CanceledExecutionException - if loading the workflow is canceled by the user (should not happen in batch mode)
        LockFailedException - if the workflow cannot be locked
        Since:
        2.7

      • runAll

        public int runAll()
        Called from main(String[]) method. It parses the command line and starts up KNIME. It returns 0 if the execution was run (even with errors) and 1 if the command line could not be parsed (e.g. usage was printed).
        Returns:
        0 if WorkflowManager (WFM) was executed, 1 otherwise.
        Since:
        2.7

      • setPreferences

        public static void setPreferences(File preferenceFile)
                           throws FileNotFoundException,
                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException
        Sets the workspace preferences using the given file.
        Parameters:
        preferenceFile - the preferences file
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the given file is not a file or does not exist
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException - if applying the preferences fails
        Since:
        2.8

      • splitWorkflowVariableArg

        public static String[] splitWorkflowVariableArg(String arg)
        Splits the argument to -workflow.variable into its sub-components (name, value, type) and returns it as array.
        Parameters:
        arg - The string to split
        Returns:
        The components of the string, no validation is done.
        Since:
        2.11

      • createWorkflowVariable

        public static FlowVariable createWorkflowVariable(String[] args)
                                           throws BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException
        Creates a new flow variable from the sub-components of the -workflow.variables commandline argument. If the string array does not meet the requirements (e.g. length = 3), an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        args - The arguments for the variable.
        Returns:
        A new flow variable.
        Throws:
        BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException
        Since:
        2.11

      • createNewConfiguration

        protected BatchExecutor.WorkflowConfiguration createNewConfiguration()
        Creates a new workflow configuration object. Subclasses may override this method to create custom workflow configurations.
        Returns:
        a new workflow configuration object
        Since:
        2.7

        Checks the workflow configuration after all paramaters have been read.
        Parameters:
        config - a workflow configuration
        Throws:
        BatchExecutor.IllegalOptionException - if an option is invalid
        Since:
        2.7
